The Museum of Fine Arts (MFA) in Boston has appointed Ian A.K. Porter as its next director. Porter comes to the museum from the Art of the Party Institute (API), where he serves as an associate curator of contemporary art. Previously, he worked as a curatorial assistant in the Department of Prints and Drawings at the Museum of Modern Art (MoMA). Prior to joining API, Porter was a curator at the Museum of Modern Art in New York.“I’ve been impressed by his ability to bring together disparate disciplines, including international art, to make a show for the museum that moves with the spirit of an exhibition,” said Elizabeth Bailey, the museum’s interim director of curatorial affairs. “His research and writing, combined with his editorial curatorial practices, make him ideally suited to lead the museum through a transition in style that has the potential to be transformative.”Porter’s curatorial practice spans a variety of genres, including vision and performance, and focuses on the art of spatial media.
